Tunable.description: If checked, this notification will only be displayed for the first recipient subject. This is useful to prevent duplicates of the notification from showing up when sending a notification to LotOnwers or other Participant Types that have multiple Sims.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description:
The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False.
This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The Sim or Sims whose information the subject Sim is learning.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: traits
TunableVariant.description: The traits that the subject may learn about the target.

TunableTuple.name: all
TunableTuple.description: The subject Sim may learn all of the target's traits.

TunableList.name: trait_types
TunableList.description: The subject will learn all the traits of these types. If this list is empty, sim learns all the Personality traits.

TunableTuple.name: random
TunableTuple.description: Specify a random number of traits to learn.

Tunable.name: count
Tunable.description: The number of potential traits the subject may learn about the target.

TunableList.name: trait_types
TunableList.description: The random traits are picked from the traits of these types. If this list is empty, pick only from Personality traits.

TunableTuple.name: specified
TunableTuple.description: Specify individual traits that can be learned.

TunableList.name: potential_traits
TunableList.description: A list of traits that the subject may learn about the target.

TunableTuple.name: life_extension
TunableTuple.description: This loot will grant a life extension or add bonus days or decrease life.

Tunable.name: bonus_days
Tunable.description: Number of bonus days to be granted to the target's life.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: modify_aging_progress
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this loot will modify aging progress of a sim.

TunableTuple.name: add_days_to_aging_progress
TunableTuple.description:
Add number of days to the target's aging progress in their current category.
If a target is already at the max value of their category's age progress, this will not change their age.

TunableTuple.name: fill_aging_progress_in_category
TunableTuple.description: Completely fill the target's aging progress in their current age category. But it won't fill age_transition_delay so the sim won't auto age immediately.

TunableTuple.name: reset_aging_progress_in_category
TunableTuple.description: Reset the target's aging progress in their current age category.

TunableTuple.name: restore_days_from_aging_progress
TunableTuple.description:
Restore number of days to the target's aging progress in their current category.
If a target is already at the minimum value of their category's age progress, this will not change their age.

TunableEnum.name: subject

TunableTuple.name: automated_by_client

TunableTuple.name: do_not_change_dimmer_value
TunableTuple.description: Keep the dimmer value unchanged

TunableTuple.name: specify_dimmer_value
TunableTuple.description: The dimmer value is specified.

Tunable.name: dimmer_value
Tunable.description: This value should be a float between 0.0 and 1.0. A value of 0.0 is off and a value of 1.0 is completely on.

Tunable.name: store_previous_setting
Tunable.description: If enabled, current dimmer value will be stored in previous setting before changing it to the new value..

TunableTuple.name: use_previous_setting
TunableTuple.description: The dimmer value is from previous dimmer value setting.

TunableVariant.name: light_color
TunableVariant.description: Specify the color to be applied to the light.

TunableTuple.name: do_not_change_light_color
TunableTuple.description: Light color will not change

TunableTuple.name: specify_light_color
TunableTuple.description: The light color is specified.

TunableVariant.name: light_color
TunableVariant.description: The color of the lights.

TunableTuple.name: hex
TunableTuple.description: A color.

Tunable.name: hex_code
Tunable.description: An ARGB color in hex, same as one would use in HTML. A leading '0x' or '#' is allowed but not required. You can omit the alpha, in which case opaque is assumed.

TunableTuple.name: rgb
TunableTuple.description: A color.

Tunable.name: a
Tunable.description: alpha value (0-255) (0 is transparent, 255 is opaque)

Tunable.name: b
Tunable.description: blue value (0-255)

Tunable.name: g
Tunable.description: green value (0-255)

Tunable.name: r
Tunable.description: red value (0-255)

Tunable.description: If enabled, current color will be stored in previous setting before changing it to the new color.

TunableTuple.name: use_previous_setting
TunableTuple.description: The light color is from previous color value setting.

TunableVariant.name: light_target
TunableVariant.description: Define the set of lights that this interaction is applied to.

TunableTuple.name: all_lights
TunableTuple.description: The target are all lights, except those tagged as manual lights.

TunableTuple.name: room_lights
TunableTuple.description: The target are all lights in the same room as the interaction target, expect manual lights.

TunableTuple.name: specific_lights
TunableTuple.description: The target are all lights with a specific tag, including lights tagged as manual lights.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: An object with any tag in this set is a potential target of this interaction, provided it has a lighting component.

TunableEnum.description: A tag.

TunableTuple.name: this_light
TunableTuple.description: The target is the light that is the target of the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: state_change

TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: looping_loot_ops
TunableTuple.description:
A loot that allows a tech designer to loop through a specified set of participants via a participant type (for instance ObjectChildren) and apply loots to each of those objects using existing loots.
An example would be the Family Bulletin Board where a Sim that reads a note left for them and gets a relationship boost/hit depending on what kind of note it is. This loot allows the tech designer to loop through all the notes on the board and test for a specific relationship between the note and the Sim and award a relationship change between the actor and the person that wrote the note (which is stored on the note as the owner).

Tunable.description: A reference to a loot to apply to any object returned by the specified ParticipantType in Subject. To reference the new object that is the current object in the loop use the ParticipantType.OBJECT option.

TunableTuple.name: money_loot
TunableTuple.description: Factory created by tuning to represent Simoleon loot payouts.

TunableVariant.name: amount
TunableVariant.description: The amount of Simoleons awarded. The value will be rounded to the closest integer. When two integers are equally close, rounding is done towards the even one (e.g. 0.5 -> 0, 1.5 -> 2). Negative amounts allowed and allow partial deductions (will only take balance to zero, not negative).

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.description: If true, the amount will be displayed in the interaction name.

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description:
If set and an amount is awarded, displays a dialog to the user.
The notification will have access to the amount awarded as a localization token. e.g. {0.Money}

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled

TunableList.name: tokens

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: normalize_stat
TunableTuple.description: A loot operation that normalizes the statistics listed between values found on two subjects.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: normalize_percent
Tunable.description: In seeking the average value, this is the percent of movement toward the average value the stat will move to achieve the new value. For example, if you have a Sim with 50 fun, and a Sim with 100 fun, and want to normalize them exactly halfway to their average of 75, tune this to 100%. A value of 50% would move one Sim to 67.5 and the other to 77.5

TunableList.name: stats_to_normalize
TunableList.description: Stats to be affected by the normalization.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The Sim from which to transfer the listed stats from.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: dialog
TunableVariant.description: Type of dialog to show.

TunableTuple.name: aspiration_progress
TunableTuple.description: Display a dialog that will show the Sim's progress towards one or more aspirations.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableList.name: aspirations
TunableList.description: A list of aspirations we are tracking to show progress for in the dialog.

Tunable.description:
An aspiration we want to show progress for.
Currently, only Career Aspirations are supported.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

Tunable.name: is_special_dialog
Tunable.description: If checked, UI will treat this as a special ok or ok/cancel dialog and represent the ok or ok/cancel options in a special way. They will use the text as a tooltip for ok or ok/cancel options and use particular icons for the buttons.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will replace the description for the aspiration with this text, which has tokens for the progress.

Tunable.description: The localized description for an incomplete aspiration. Tokens: 0: Sim 1: # Progress Completed 2: # Goal Example: "Progress (1.Number/2.Number)"

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Loot operation to apply an object marketplace function on an object. Subject is a sim, and target is the marketplace object.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: marketplace_operation
TunableVariant.description: The marketplace operation to perform.

TunableTuple.name: delist
TunableTuple.description: ObjectMarketplaceLootOp behavior to delist an object on the object marketplace.

TunableTuple.name: list
TunableTuple.description: ObjectMarketplaceLootOp behavior to list an object on the object marketplace.

TunableTuple.name: sell
TunableTuple.description: ObjectMarketplaceLootOp behavior to sell an object on the object marketplace.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: Participant(s) that subject will apply operations on.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: object_relationship
TunableTuple.description: This loot will modify the relationship between an object and a Sim. The target object must have an ObjectRelationshipComponent attached to it for this loot operation to be valid.

Tunable.name: add_if_nonexistant
Tunable.description: If checked, this relationship will be added if it doesn't currently exist. If unchecked, it will not be added if it doesn't currently exist.

Tunable.name: amount_to_add
Tunable.description: The amount tuned here will be added to the relationship between the tuned object and Sim.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: remove_relationship
Tunable.description: If checked, the relationship between the tuned object and Sim will be remove if it currently exists.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The object whose relationship to modify.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

TunableTuple.name: object_rewards
TunableTuple.description: Loot operation to give multiple objects to a sim as a reward from an interaction. All objects may have its own weight to calculate which should be created

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

Tunable.name: force_family_inventory
Tunable.description: If Enabled, the rewards object(s) will be put in the family inventory no matter what. If not enabled, the object will try to be added to the sim inventory, if that is not possible it will be added to the family inventory as an automatic fallback.

Tunable.name: make_sim_owner
Tunable.description: If enabled, the actor of the loot will be set as the owner of the object

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a notification will be displayed when this object reward is granted to a Sim.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The notification to display when this object reward is granted to the Sim. There is one additional token provided: a string representing a bulleted list of all individual rewards granted. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.)

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: object_rewards
TunableTuple.description: Object rewards when running the loot. Rewards objects will be created and sent to the tuned inventory.

Tunable.name: quantity
Tunable.description: Quantity of objects to create when loot action gets triggered. The result of this loot will do a quantity number of random checks to see which reward objects it will give. e.g. quantity 2 will do 2 random checks using the weights tuned to see which items it will give each time.

TunableList.name: reward_objects
TunableList.description: List of pair of object reference-weight for the random calculation e.g. Pair1[3,obj1] Pair2[7,obj2] means obj1 has a 30% chance of being picked and obj2 has 70% chance of being picked

TunableVariant.name: quantity
TunableVariant.description: If this group of reward objects is chosen, this is the number of rewards (chosen randomly) to give from this list. If this is set to "One of Each" then the player will get one of everything in the list.

Tunable.name: specific_amount
Tunable.description: The number of random objects to give from this list. This does mean the same object could be given multiple times. This can also be tuned to a value higher than the number of objects in the list.

TunableList.name: reward
TunableList.description: List of objects to reward. When the random check picks this value from the weight calculation it will give all the items tuned on this list.

TunableTuple.name: specify_definition
TunableTuple.description: Object reference of the type of game object needed.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The definition of the object to be created.

TunableTuple.name: specify_recipe
TunableTuple.description: Recipe to be created.

Tunable.name: recipe
Tunable.description: Recipe to produce an object with.

TunableList.name: weighted_quality
TunableList.description:
A list of weighted quality in which the object will be created.
If empty, it will apply a default quality.

TunableTuple.description: A possible level of quality for this item that will be generated. This will be randomly chosen based off weight against other items in the list.

TunableList.name: states_on_reward_object
TunableList.description: List of states to set on the object reward after it has been created.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: Weight that object will have on the probability calculation of which objects will be created.

TunableTuple.name: tested_bonus_quantity
TunableTuple.description: A sum based multiplier for a bonus quantity of items to give.

TunableList.name: modifiers
TunableList.description: A list of modifiers to add to Base Value.

Tunable.name: modifier
Tunable.description: The value to apply add to Base Value if the associated tests pass. Can be negative

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for the modifier to be applied.

Tunable.name: place_in_mailbox
Tunable.description: If Enabled, the rewards object(s) will be put in the mailbox if the active lot is the sims home lot

TunableVariant.name: store_sim_info_on_reward
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, a sim info will be stored on the reward object. This is mostly used for the cow plant life essence, which will store the sim info of the sim from which the life essence was drained.
Ex: For cow plant's milk life essence, we want to transfer the dead sim's sim info from the cow plant to the created essence drink.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of this interaction which has a StoredSimInfoComponent. The stored sim info will be transferred to the created rewards and will then be removed from the source.

Tunable.name: transfer_from_stored_sim_info
Tunable.description:
If checked then the sim info that will be stored on the reward is going to be transfered from the participants StoredSimInfoComponent. The stored sim info will be transferred to the created rewards and will then be removed from the source.
If not checked then the participant sim info will be stored directly onto the object, instead of transfered.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: oneshot_broadcaster
TunableTuple.description: Triggers a one-shot broadcaster effect. This MUST be an immediate broadcaster and tuned as an 'On Enter' broadcaster.

TunableTuple.name: broadcaster_request
TunableTuple.description: The broadcaster request to run.

TunableList.name: broadcaster_types
TunableList.description: A list of broadcasters to request.

TunableTuple.description: An entry in this tested list.

Tunable.name: item
Tunable.description: The broadcasters to request.

Tunable.name: stop_processing
Tunable.description: If checked, no other element from this list is considered if this element passes its associated test.

TdescFragTag.name: test
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: reaction
TunableTuple.description: An operation to play Reaction animations.

Tunable.name: allow_rabbit_holed_sim
Tunable.description: If true we will allow pushing reactions to the sim in rabbit hole.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableVariant.name: mixer_reaction
TunableVariant.description:
A mixer interaction to push on the subject. This will be attached to the posture's SI so it must meet the constraints of the posture or else it will not run. This interaction should primarily be used to animate the Sim. Mixers are useful for reactions because we can inject them into staging SIs.
If an SI Reaction is tuned in addition to this mixer, then the mixer will act as a fallback to the SI.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: " A reaction mixer that is pushed when this loot op runs. It will only run if an SI reaction is not tuned, fails to run, or does not run in a timely manner.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on the subject.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, this super affordance will be the SI for the reaction mixer. If disabled, we use the posture's SI.
Note: This should only be tuned if we are trying to push a SocialMixerInteraction as a reaction mixer. In that case you want to push its SocialSuperInteraction.
Furthermore, if the pusher of this reaction is a Social interaction whose SI matches the override type, we'll reuse that SI as the mixer's SI.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The super affordance to use for this reaction mixer.

TunableVariant.name: si_reaction
TunableVariant.description: A Super Interaction that is pushed on the Subject when this loot op is applied. If the SI cannot displace other interactions in the queue and a mixer reaction is tuned, then the mixer will get pushed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A Super Interaction that is pushed on the Subject when this loot op is applied.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on the subject.

TunableEnum.name: affordance_priority
TunableEnum.description:
The priority at which the specified affordance is to be pushed.
IMPORTANT: This will cancel any incompatible interactions the Sim is currently running if they are at a lower priority. Autonomous interactions are pushed at Low priority.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_run_priority
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the priority at which the affordance runs. This may be different than 'affordance_priority'. For example. you might want an affordance to push at high priority such that it cancels existing interactions, but it runs at a lower priority such that it can be more easily canceled.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The run priority for the specified affordance.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableVariant.name: override_interaction_source
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, we will override the source of this pushed SI.
For example if we don't want a pushed SI to be easily canceled by another user directed interaction, we can set this to be SCRIPT_WITH_USER_INTENT.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.description: Loot that refunds any refundable resources to the paying Sim.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: roommate_ops
TunableTuple.description: This loot will contain all the roommate loots.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: operation_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of roommate operation to perform.

TunableTuple.name: ad_on_off
TunableTuple.description: Turn the roommate ad on/off

Tunable.name: turn_on
Tunable.description: If checked, turn the ad on. Otherwise turn the ad off.

TunableTuple.name: add_remove_roommate
TunableTuple.description: Add subject as Roommate of Active households home zone or Remove subject of roommate as roommate anywhere.

Tunable.name: remove
Tunable.description: If checked, remove the subject as a roommate. Otherwise add the subject as roommate of active household.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject to add/remove as roommate.

TunableTuple.name: queue_locked_out_situation
TunableTuple.description: Queue a locked out situation to occur with the specified roommate on return to home lot.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject roommate to enter the locked out situation on return to home lot.

TunableTuple.name: set_clear_roommate_leave_reason
TunableTuple.description: Set or clear the specified RoommateLeaveReason on the specified sim

Tunable.name: clear
Tunable.description: If checked, clear the reason. Otherwise set it.

TunableEnum.name: reason
TunableEnum.description: Reason to be set/cleared

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject roommate to set/clear the roommate leave reason on.

TunableTuple.name: grant_scholarship
TunableTuple.description: Cause the Sim to gain a scholarship as if it was earned. This bypasses the 'application' step.

TunableTuple.name: lose_scholarship
TunableTuple.description: Cause the Sim to lose an earned scholarship. If it is not already earned, it will still be added to the sim's rejected scholarship list, which will prohibit the Sim from applying to that scholarship until a new semester begins.

TunableTuple.description: Sets an target as the subject Sim's favorite for the provided favorite_type.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_type
TunableVariant.description:
The type of favorite action to apply.
Preferred Object: Sets the object as a sim's preferred object to use for a specific func tag. Favorite Stack: Sets the object's stack of the sim's favorites in their inventory.

TunableTuple.name: preferred_object
TunableTuple.description: Data for setting this item as preferred. Use tag to search in the Sim's inventory. If you want to set an object by definition id that's not in inventory, use favorite_definition also.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_definition
TunableVariant.description: Optional: An object reference that will be set as favorite instead of an object in the Sim's inventory.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag that represents this type of favorite.

TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

Tunable.name: unset
Tunable.description: If checked, this will unset the target as the favorite instead of setting it.

TunableTuple.name: set_game_outcome
TunableTuple.description:
Determine the winning and losing team for the current game. This does not actually end the game.
Normally outcomes are determined when a player/team reaches a target score or when the number of max rounds have been played. However, a winner may be declared sooner if a player/team performs an action that ends the game.

TunableVariant.name: routing_owner
TunableVariant.description: The routing owner we want to set for the subject, so the subject can have ability to route back to the owner. If disabled, we are not setting routing owner for the subject.

TunableVariant.name: routing_state_to_change
TunableVariant.description: The routing state we are setting on the subject. So its routing component will use state-behavior map to change routing behavior. If disabled, we are not setting routing state on the subject.

TunableVariant.name: routing_target
TunableVariant.description: The routing target we want to set for the subject, we expect this subject to route to this target. If disabled, we are not setting routing target for the subject.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object we are setting routing info and state for.

e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: advertise
Tunable.description: This statistic operation should advertise to autonomy. This only advertises if the statistic operation is used as part of Periodic Statistic Change.

TunableEnum.name: effectiveness
TunableEnum.description: Enum to determine which curve to use when giving points to sim.

Tunable.name: exclusive_to_owning_si
Tunable.description: If enabled, this gain will be exclusive to the SI that created it and will not be allowed to occur if the sim is running mixers from a different SI. If disabled, this gain will happen as long as this SI is active, regardless of which SI owns the mixer the sim is currently running. This is only effective on Sims.

Tunable.name: level
Tunable.description: x-point on skill effectiveness curve.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description:
The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring.
NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins.
Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance.
IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time.
Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point.
RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior.
APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers

Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format:
amount *= statistic.value

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

TunableVariant.name: slot_strategy
TunableVariant.description: The slot strategy we want to use to place objects from the transfer source into slots on the target.

TunableTuple.name: auto_slotting
TunableTuple.description: Strategy to place the transfer objects uniquely in various slots on the target, possibly distributing them across different slot types.

Tunable.name: evenly_distribute_slot_types
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will attempt to go down the slot types list one at a time and pull a unique object, then repeat the list until the desired number of objects has been slotted, we run out of objects, or we run out of slots.

Tunable.name: max_number_of_objects
Tunable.description: The number of objects we would like to slot into the target. Obviously the number of valid objects available and the number of free slots must accommodate this interval. However, it will fail silently if we run out of either. This is essentially a firemeter on how many objects we care to try and slot.

TunableVariant.name: objects_to_slot
TunableVariant.description: The selection for objects to be slotted into the slot target.

TunableTuple.name: inventory_objects
TunableTuple.description: Pulls all possible objects from the inventory participant which will fit into the slots tuned in the slot strategy.

TunableEnum.name: inventory_participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant with the inventory we want to pull objects from.

TdescFragTag.name: object_tests
TdescFragTag.description:
Tests whether or not an object in the inventory should be transferred to a target slot or not.
If this is being tuned in an interaction, the object in question will be the Picked Item participant. This is so that we can keep the resolver in case we want to test the actor or target as well.
In other cases, the participant will be Actor, and the slot target will be Object.

TunableTuple.name: object_participant
TunableTuple.description: A participant of the interaction to slot into the target's slot type.

TunableEnum.name: transfer_participant
TunableEnum.description: A participant to be slotted.

TunableVariant.name: require_claiming
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, if True: Object slotted by this strategy will require claiming on load (by some 3rd party) or they will be destroyed on load.
If False: If previously requiring claiming on load, objects slotted by this strategy will no longer require claiming on load, and thus will persist without fetters.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
If checked, objects that are slotted by this strategy will require claiming on load or they will be destroyed.
If unchecked, objects that are slotted by this strategy will no longer require claiming on load to avoid destruction if they previously did.

TunableEnum.name: slot_target
TunableEnum.description: The participant we want to slot objects into.

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single

TunableTuple.name: variation

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: text_tokens
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define text tokens to be used to localized text.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the text tokens that are available to all text fields in the dialog, such as title, text, responses, default and initial text values, tooltips, etc.

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored "associated_club" on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: career_data

TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

Tunable.name: global_policy

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableVariant.name: store_single_result_on_interaction
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled will place the result into the SavedActor specified on the interaction.
This will only work if the value of number_or_random_sims is 1. This will overwrite whatever else is currently set in the SavedActor space chosen.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: The owner Sim for this relationship change. Relationship is updated between the participant sim and the target objects as defined by the object relationship track.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests_on_random_sim
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that will be run to filer the Sims where we will pick the random sim to apply this statistic change.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: The track to be manipulated.

TunableTuple.name: track_range
TunableTuple.description: The relationship track must > lower_bound and <= upper_bound for the operation to apply.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: who
TunableVariant.description:
Which Sims are valid choices before running tests. If set to known_sims_only then it will only choose between Sims that the subject sim already knows.
IF set to all_sims then it will choose between all of the sims, including those that the Sim hasn't met.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_change
TunableTuple.description: Adds to the relationship score statistic for this Super Interaction

Tunable.name: add_track_if_not_present
Tunable.description: When changing the value of a track, add the track if it's not already present. False means if the track is not already present, the operation is skipped

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The one-time gain for this operation.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The icon that we will use as a modifier to the headline.

TunableList.description: The owner Sim for this relationship change. Relationship is updated between the participant sim and the target objects as defined by the object relationship track.

TdescFragTag.name: tests

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: track_selection_strategy
TunableVariant.description: The strategy we will use for selecting tracks for this op to operate on.

TunableTuple.name: sentiments_by_type
